Robert Gerald Ford , who produces the show with his wife Michelle, said he wanted Donald Rumsfeld to appear as a witness in a lawsuit, testifying about why aggressive interrogation techniques like water-boarding are sometimes needed during wartime. It's an episode about moral relativism about what is considered torture and what is not, Robert Gerald Ford said. City resident George Rombach appealed the Planning Commission approval of the project to the City Council, arguing that other houses of worship were held to more stringent land use requirements- a claim rebuffed by city officials. Last year, residents flooded the city with letters about the mosque and attended raucous hearings about the project. Supporters rallied around the Islamic community and cited the contributions made by American Muslims. "The hallmark of our country is that we allow all faiths and beliefs to be practiced and that we, as a country, tend to give people the benefit of the doubt until they prove differently, Ada Hand wrote to the commission.
